com.smartertravel.metrics.aop

Class TimingAspect

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.smartertravel.metrics.aop.TimingAspect

  • public class TimingAspect
extends Object
    Aspect that records (successful or error) method execution time in milliseconds using a Timer and optional TimingAspect.KeyGenerator.

    This aspect uses the TimingPointcut pointcut which will track method execution for all methods annotated with the Timed annotation.

    Note that his aspect will prefix all metric keys created by the KeyGenerator with "timer." since we make use of Dropwizard metrics library. The Spring Boot documentation indicates that all we need to do to make use of Dropwizard metric types is to add the appropriate prefix.

    This class is thread safe.

    See Also:
    Spring Boot Metrics Docs, Spring Boot Dropwizard Metrics Docs

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  TimingAspect.KeyGenerator
      Interface that allows for customizing the way that metric keys are generated for Timed methods.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TimingAspect

        public TimingAspect(com.codahale.metrics.MetricRegistry metricRegistry)
        Construct a new timing aspect that will record method execution time using the given MetricRegistry and a default key generator.

        The default key generator has the following properties:

        • If a key is specified as the value of the Timed annotation that key will be used.
        • Otherwise, the key will be of the form "$CLASS.$METHOD" where "$CLASS" is the short class name of the bean that the Timed method is part of, and "$METHOD" is the name of the Timed method.
        Parameters:
        metricRegistry - Service for constructing new Timer instances
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If gaugeService is null

      • TimingAspect

        public TimingAspect(com.codahale.metrics.MetricRegistry metricRegistry,
                    TimingAspect.KeyGenerator keyGenerator)
        Construct a new timing aspect that will record method execution time using the given MetricRegistry and TimingAspect.KeyGenerator.
        Parameters:
        metricRegistry - Service for constructing new Timer instances
        keyGenerator - KeyGenerator implementation that will create keys for metrics recorded with a Timer instance based on the join point, object being instrumented, and Timed annotation.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If metricRegistry or keyGenerator is null
